item.title: By: Vroxx
item.dc:creator: Vroxx
item.description: Vanguards launch will be Anarchy Online all over again.
item.content:encoded: Vanguards launch will be Anarchy Online all over again.

item.title: By: jason
item.dc:creator: jason
item.description: I want to play Vanguard... I do. My computer, however, simply refuses to run the game. Okay, it runs it, but the character creator had trouble loading. It was sloooooow. Meanwhile, my PC just loves WoW, zip zip zip!
item.content:encoded: I want to play Vanguard… I do. My computer, however, simply refuses to run the game. Okay, it runs it, but the character creator had trouble loading. It was sloooooow. Meanwhile, my PC just loves WoW, zip zip zip!

item.title: By: BigFreak
item.dc:creator: BigFreak
item.description: (EQ2 vs WoW) II [parenthesised for clarity]: The Second Fall. Yeah, this has mistake written all over it in rainbow-coloured highlighters. Applied to get into the Euro beta as it went up last night...not many keys going though, so we'll have to see. I'm liking a few ideas this game has, but really don't know enough about it. Opinions guys? From the videos I've seen, it seems to have a few graphical issues (players striking at flying mobs and clearly not hitting, etc), but some promising features (player housing, shops, etc). Definitely gonna give it a go.
item.content:encoded: (EQ2 vs WoW) II [parenthesised for clarity]: The Second Fall. Yeah, this has mistake written all over it in rainbow-coloured highlighters. Applied to get into the Euro beta as it went up last night…not many keys going though, so we’ll have to see. I’m liking a few ideas this game has, but really don’t know enough about it. Opinions guys? From the videos I’ve seen, it seems to have a few graphical issues (players striking at flying mobs and clearly not hitting, etc), but some promising features (player housing, shops, etc). Definitely gonna give it a go.

item.title: By: Ghiest
item.dc:creator: Ghiest
item.description: I've also been in beta, but for quite sometime and the overhaul the game has just 'recently' had is immense and it's just not ready for release. If they do release it then, well it is suicide really. Did they not learn with Eq2 vs WoW in the first place?
item.content:encoded: I’ve also been in beta, but for quite sometime and the overhaul the game has just ‘recently’ had is immense and it’s just not ready for release. If they do release it then, well it is suicide really. Did they not learn with Eq2 vs WoW in the first place?

item.title: By: Saylah
item.dc:creator: Saylah
item.description: Eardon, are you off your meds again? I've only spent a few hours in the VG beta and I can't see it hitting the streets in January unless suicide is what someone wants. It's just not ready. Perhaps they're going to hire Santa's Elves as late nite workers to pull it off. With inflation and all, even elves need a little extra cash.
item.content:encoded: Eardon, are you off your meds again? I’ve only spent a few hours in the VG beta and I can’t see it hitting the streets in January unless suicide is what someone wants. It’s just not ready. Perhaps they’re going to hire Santa’s Elves as late nite workers to pull it off. With inflation and all, even elves need a little extra cash.

item.title: By: Relmstein
item.dc:creator: Relmstein
item.description:
Yup its the real release date. Some think SOE is forcing Sigil to release at the same time as the Burning Crusade in an attempt to sabotage it. After all a lot of Sigil employees would probably find themselves working for SOE again if Sigil went down in flames.
The other theory is like what Ryan mentioned above. Sigil knows that only hardcore players who aren't really fans of WoW will play their game. Thus they don't really see any need to hold back the release date anymore since rumors say they are hurting for cash. With a lot of their fans already having all-access passes from SOE they just need to move the boxes.
item.content:encoded:
Yup its the real release date. Some think SOE is forcing Sigil to release at the same time as the Burning Crusade in an attempt to sabotage it. After all a lot of Sigil employees would probably find themselves working for SOE again if Sigil went down in flames.

The other theory is like what Ryan mentioned above. Sigil knows that only hardcore players who aren’t really fans of WoW will play their game. Thus they don’t really see any need to hold back the release date anymore since rumors say they are hurting for cash. With a lot of their fans already having all-access passes from SOE they just need to move the boxes.

item.title: By: Ryan Shwayder
item.dc:creator: Ryan Shwayder
item.description: If that's the correct date, they'll have a hell of a challenge on their hands. However, a lot of the audience is separate, so I think they'll still get most of their hardcore players upfront, even if the others don't follow until/unless they get bored with Burning Crusade (or whatever other game they are playing at the time).
item.content:encoded: If that’s the correct date, they’ll have a hell of a challenge on their hands. However, a lot of the audience is separate, so I think they’ll still get most of their hardcore players upfront, even if the others don’t follow until/unless they get bored with Burning Crusade (or whatever other game they are playing at the time).
